perturbation.original_text: The invoices will be issued by EIT at the start of each term.  Such invoice must be paid by the customer within 45 days of the date on which the invoice is issued.
perturbation.changed_text: The invoices will be issued by EIT at the start of each term. Such invoice must be paid by the customer within 90 days of the date on which the invoice is issued.
perturbation.explanation: This change extends the payment term from 45 days to 90 days. According to Spanish Law 3/2004, which establishes measures to combat late payments in commercial transactions, the standard payment term is 30 days unless otherwise agreed, and any extension beyond 60 days must be explicitly agreed upon and justified. By unilaterally setting a 90-day payment term without justification or explicit agreement, the modified text contradicts Spanish payment regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Spanish Law 3/2004 (Ley 3/2004, de 29 de diciembre, por la que se establecen medidas de lucha contra la morosidad en las operaciones comerciales)
